sense.name: a nutrient, any nourishing substance
sense.examples: The fast food industry is under pressure to eliminate trans-fats from their products. Plants use sunlight to make their own food. The government has modified the food pyramid in recent years. The food critics are raving about the new French-Cuban restaurant. The chef's duck confit with burgundy sauce and truffles is food for the gods!

sense.name: nutrient in a solid form
sense.commentary: FOOD[+substance][+physical][+nutrient][+solid] Note: the emphasis of this sense is on the solidity, in contrast to a liquid
sense.examples: Will they serve us food and drink on the patio? John is tired of his liquid diet and wants some real food. The airlines are charging for food on board nowadays, but juice and soda are still free.

sense.name: anything that challenges or sustains contemplation
sense.examples: His lecture on the future of cloning contained much food for thought. Poetry is food for the soul.
